intro: Perityle spilanthoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved perityle, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Perityle spilanthoides is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
